intro: Maytenus sprucei, commonly known as the Brazilian huito, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces yellowish fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
